newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia budget to focus on services sector - Anwar.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia budget to focus on services sector - Anwar.

text.p: Malaysian Deputy Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim has said the services sector, especially the hotel and tourism industry, will be given priority in next month's 1997 budget, the New Straits Times reported on Saturday.
Anwar, who is also finance minister, said this was because the sector acted as a catalyst to the country's economic growth and that it did not involve huge government allocations.
"Not only as a catalyst but to propel the country's development to a higher growth rate," he was quoted as saying at a ground-breaking ceremony of a hotel project.
Anwar said the services sector was expected to play a more significant role as Malaysia strived to become an industrial economy from one relying largely on agriculture.
Besides the tourism industry, the government placed strong emphasis on the development of the information technology and financial sectors, he added.
